newschoolyear.title: Welcome to the new school year
newschoolyear.intro: To be able to deliver Skolelyst til your students, we need to know what school and class they go to. Please select the new school (if it has changed from last year) and the new school class for the students.
newschoolyear.notready: The school has not prepared the new school year yet. You can still continue ordering, but you will not be able to order for %(name)s.
newschoolyear.readydesc: You have already specified that %(name)s will go to %(class)s at %(school)s next school year. If this is not correct, you can change school class.
newschoolyear.howto: To be able to deliver Skolelyst, we need to know what school class %(name)s is in. You can
newschoolyear.howtoend: here. If the school is not prepared for ordering yet, you can still order for any other students going to school that have prepared.

receiptpanel.title: Smartlapper.no
receiptpanel.receivebutton: Click here and receive 24 free name tags from Smartlapper.no
receiptpanel.receivetext: We offer to all those who book a subscription on Skolelyst free name tags that can be used on food boxes, books, clothes, helmets, etc.

dialog.title: Get your name tags
dialog.retrieve: You are now forwarded to Smartlapper.no to get your free name tags.
dialog.explanation1: Smartlapper.no must have contact information to know where the name tags should be sent, and they must also know how many children you have to know how many free name tags you are entitled to.
dialog.explanation2: The information sharing takes place only this one time and you will create your own profile on Smartlapper.no where you can edit your consent.
dialog.mustaccept: You must agree to the Terms of Service to continue.

notifications.success: Your contact information has been sent to Smartlapper.no
notifications.failure: Failed to send your contact information to Smartlapper.no

profile.reminder: You have given consent for Skolelyst to be able of sharing information (email address, name, address and number of children) to Smartlapper (Navnelapper AS) in relation to the fact that you were offered 88 free name tags. This was a one-time event where the information sharing took place and you will be able to edit your consent

customer.allorders: We have included all you orders, both active and previously filed, so you always have an overview of what you have ordered and at what time.

welcome.title: Welcome %(name)s!
welcome.preface1: In this page, you can set up the school year and prepare for orders, or edit the school year.
welcome.preface2: Below you will find the school(s) you are affiliated with, with active/inactive school years. To prepare a school year so the pupils in your school can order products, you click in to the school year and follow the guide, which will tell you the steps to go through to prepare everything for orders.
welcome.preface3: If you wish to return to this page, just click on "My page" in the menu at the top right.

createyear.bereadyforfall: Set up the new school year already, so you are ready for the autumn.
createyear.title: Start a new school year for %(startDate)s - %(endDate)s
createyear.schoolroute-basis: The school route for the whole country is the basis of the dates in the calendar.
createyear.desc: The school year will run from %(startDate)s until %(endDate)s.
createyear.firstdelivery: The first delivery day at school start
createyear.firstdeliverywhy: In order to deliver products from the first school day, we would like to be able to deliver products a few days before the school year starts. Below you can indicate when the school would be able to receive the first delivery:
createyear.delivery_suggestion: First delivery on %(delivery)s, so the pupils will have products available from %(from)s.
createyear.problem: The indicated date is not a valid date.
createyear.schoolyear-notfound: The school route has not been added. Contact customer service on telephone 513 71 510.

digitalpicklists.title: Digital distribution lists
digitalpicklists.download1: Now you can get the distribution lists on your phone/tablet. Go to
digitalpicklists.download3: Take good care of this code. You can create a new code if it's lost or you just need another one. The words are generated at random

securekey.failure: Error generating code. Please try again

prepackaged.heading: How do you want your products delivered from TINE Skolelyst?
prepackaged.notice: NB! It will not be possible to change delivery method after the school year has started.

packaged.point1: Every schoo class receives a prepackaged bag for each day.
packaged.point2: The school has to offer at least 8 different products.
packaged.point3: Each bag includes distribution list for the products in that bag.
packaged.point4: Simple for students to collect the milk from the refrigerator (separate bags per day).
packaged.point6: An adult only needs to supervise the pick up.
packaged.description: The products are delivered as prepackaged.

trays.point1: The products are delivered on trays and the school has to organize distribution for each classroom using milk crates.
trays.point2: The scholl has to offer at least 4 different products.
trays.point3: The school needs to organize the refridgerator before each delivery from TINE Skolelyst.
trays.point4: NB! On skolelyst.no, parents can select multiple and different products for each day. This will also be available with delivery on trays.
trays.point5: The school is responsible for printing updated distribution lists weekly.
trays.button: We would like delivery on trays
trays.description: The products are delivered on trays.

edityear.bereadyforfall: Set up the new school year already, so you are ready for the autumn.
edityear.title: Change school calendar for %(startDate)s - %(endDate)s
edityear.desc: The school year will run from %(startDate)s until %(endDate)s.
edityear.problem: The indicated date is not a valid date.
edityear.schoolyear-notfound: The county your school is located in has not set a start and end date for the school year yet. Contact Customer service.

classdaysoff.help: Mark days off for the class, such as school camp or class trips. The parents will not pay for days that are marked as days off.

studentbusiness.heading: Pupil program
studentbusiness.description: With a pupil program, the distribution is easier! The pupil program is educational and gives the pupils a sense of achievement. In addition, the school receives a reward that can be used in the grade that takes the job.
studentbusiness.responsible: Person in charge of the pupil program
studentbusiness.accountnumberdescription: Select an account the money for the pupil program will be paid to.
studentbusiness.existing: You are participating in the pupil program and a reward is on its way :)
studentbusiness.deleteconfirmtext: Are you sure you want to terminate the pupil program at your school? If yes, please give us feedback on the reason:

sfopanel.header: Does the school have an after-school program?

exsistingproductsinschoolyear.body: You can not remove products that have active subscriptions.

schooladmin.seeavailableproductsbelow: Below you will see the products TINE can offer at your school
schooladmin.youhavetochoose3products: Please observe! You must select a minimum of 4 products. Havredrikk and Lettmelk 0,5% has to be choosen. Havredrikk must be offered to give students a milk-free alternative, which is in line with the Norwegian Directorate of Health's recommendations.
schooladmin.youhavetochoose6products: Please observe! You must select a minimum of 8 products. Havredrikk and Lettmelk 0,5% has to be choosen. Havredrikk must be offered to give students a milk-free alternative, which is in line with the Norwegian Directorate of Health's recommendations..
schooladmin.minimumthreeproducts: The school must have a minimum of 4 products available to be approved as a School milk school.
schooladmin.minimumsixproducts: The school must have a minimum of 8 products available to be approved as a School milk school.
schooladmin.chooseclasses: Mark the classes you wish to set up
schooladmin.registeredclassesinfo: Create class calender so that parents do not buy products when students are not at school.
schooladmin.schoolcalenderinfo: This can include days such trips, school trips, summer camp  and so on. If you do not create class calender, the schools calendar will be chosen by default.
schooladmin.numberofproductsavailableatyourschool: As of today, your school offers %(number)s products:
schooladmin.frontpagecalendartext: Here you approve the school year %(year)s, add the calendar and open up for orders.
schooladmin.clicktodownloadpicklists: Click below to download this week’s PDF of the "distribution list in the classroom" and/or "pick list for the refrigerator".
schooladmin.minimumoneday: Must choose which days the student will receive products on.
schooladmin.youhavenoclassesregistered: You have no registered classes yet.
schooladmin.changecalendarforyearhere: Here you can manage the school year for your school, and add days off / planning days.

prepackagedclasssets.title: Prepackaged class sets

facts.1: As part of a healthy diet and an active lifestyle, calcium and protein are necessary for children’s bones to grow and develop normally. Milk and dairy products contain several nutrients that our body needs every day, and are the most important source of calcium and iodine in the Norwegian diet.
facts.2: In the opinion of the Norwegian Directorate of Health, from an educational perspective, meals are a basic factor to promote concentration and learning*. In their guidelines, they recommend that the school meal every day should consist of milk, bread and cereal products and vegetables, fruit or berries.
facts.3: The Norwegian Directorate of Health recommend that the school meal should contain skimmed or semi-skimmed milk, combined with bread and some fruit. If you are not fond of drinking milk, you can eat yogurt or cheese. It may then be good to know that there is about as much calcium in one glass of milk as in one cup of yoghurt or two thick slices of cheese.
facts.4: As part of a healthy diet and an active lifestyle, vitamin B12 contributes to the normal function of the immune system. One has also observed that vitamins B2 and B12 can contribute to reducing tiredness and fatigue.

mealplanner.seeproducttypes: Read more about our product types here:

typeinfotext.milk: Milk and dairy products are the most important sources of calcium and iodine in the Norwegian diet. As part of a healthy diet and an active lifestyle, calcium is necessary for children’s bones to grow and develop normally. Iodine contributes to children’s normal growth and normal cognitive function.
typeinfotext.juice: Fruit and fruit squash are sources of vitamin C. As part of a healthy diet and an active life, vitamin C contributes to the normal function of the immune system. Both fruit squashes can be included as one of the "5 a day".
typeinfotext.yoghurt: As part of a healthy diet and an active lifestyle, protein and calcium are necessary for children’s bones to grow and develop normally.  The school yoghurt is a good source of protein and calcium. Yoghurt is also a source of vitamin B12, which can contribute to reducing tiredness and fatigue.
typeinfotext.fruit: Fruit and fruit squash are sources of vitamin C. As part of a healthy diet and an active life, vitamin C contributes to the normal function of the immune system. The fruit from Skolelyst can be included as one of the "5 a day".
